_header: Jesu king of high heaven above
Bibliographic Ghosts: Cambridge UK, Cambridge University Library Kk.1.6, ff.30v-32: incorrect reference?
_description: The ‘Chartre of Pardon’, in the English translation of Deguileville’s Pèlerinage de l’âme — fourteen stanzas rhyme royal

Bod770.First Lines:
IHesu king of heuen aboueto Micher my chier lieu
                    tenaunt…
Bod770.Last Lines:
…I ȝeue it hem þat schul my merci haueWiþ out
                    whiche no wiȝt ne wil y haue

OxfCCC237.First Lines:
Ihesu kyng of heuene aboueTho mychaell my chefe
                    lefetenaunt…
OxfCCC237.Last Lines:
…I ȝeve it hem þat schull my mercy haueWhich ontyn
                    weche no wyghte ne wolle I haue

CamGon124.First Lines:
JHesu kyng of hyȝe heuen abouevn to michel my chiere
                    heutenaunt…
CamGon124.Last Lines:
…I ȝeue hit þeim þat schal my mercy
                    haueWiþouten wich no wyȝt ne wul I saue

BLAdd34193.First Lines:
Jhesu kynge of heuen aboueTo mychael my chefe
                    luþtenaunte…
BLAdd34193.Last Lines:
…I ȝiue hem þat schall my mercy haueWiþ oute
                    whiche no wighte will I haue

BLEge615.First Lines: Ihu kyng of hie heuen a boveVn to Michael my chief lieu tenaunt…
BLEge615.Last Lines: …I geve it him þat schal myn mercy craveWithowt wich no wight wil I crave
BLEge615.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             “Hoccleve’s Works: The Regement of Princes and fourteen minor
                poems.” 
             EETS
         e.s. 72 (1897); repr. 1988: xxviii-xxxi.

NYPLSpenc19.First Lines:
Ihesu kyng of high heuene aboueVn to michael my chief lien
                    tenaunt…
NYPLSpenc19.Last Lines:
…I ȝeue it hem that shulle my mercy haueWith oute which
                    no wyght wole I saue
